description: Each episode follows Fukuzou Moguro, a traveling salesman, and his current customer. Moguro deals in things that give his customers their heart's desire, and once his deals are made and their unhealthy desires are satisfied, Moguro's customers are often left with terrible repercussions, especially if they break the rules of his deals...
hashtag: #笑ゥNEW #ドーン #喪黒福造 #心のスキマ

node.description: __Masanori Yumiya__ is a Japanese animation planner and producer.
Michiyoshi Minamisawa is a sound producer and the representative director of 81 Produce.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/藤子不二雄A)

Motoo Abiko, better known as Fujio A Fujiko, was part of the former manga-writing duo [Fujio Fujiko](https://anilist.co/staff/219230/).
**Houjou Makoto (北條真)** is a Japanese producer and animation planner.
Masayuki Sano is a planner and producer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

Notably, the score for [Top wo Nerae! Gunbuster](https://anilist.co/anime/949/) made his name and talent very famous among anime fans, and is recognized as one of his most important works. He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

In 2002, he won the first Tokyo Anime Award for Best Music for his work on [Overman King Gainer](https://anilist.co/anime/1792/).
Katsunori Narumo is an animation producer.
**Hiroyasu Oyama** is a Japanese producer and animation planner.
